comment: His class demands a lot of your time. Find another CAE professor if you don't want a semester long project. His lectures are informative.

Prof Mayeed is very understanding and willing to provide feedback whenever you would like it. Computer Aided Engineering was difficult but he was lenient on submissions and very helpful on his grading. I missed class a lot but still managed a B in the class because he was so understanding of my 40 hour work week. Nothing but respect for him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof Mayeed is approachable, funny, kind and laid back. His lectures are full of examples that will prepare you for the mini tests, midterm and final. He is the only teacher in the engineering dept fully aware that students take classes other than his.

Couple quizzes (kind of hard), midterm, final, and a huge project that spans the entire semester. This project is unreasonably hard. Turn in updates each week which he provides no feedback on. No idea our project had a bunch of errors until midterm presentation few weeks before final presentation. Ours didn't work and we didn't have time to fix it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The paper is the hardest part of this class. Pick a good group and it will be fine.

Very knowledgeable professor. Has laid back teaching style and always makes class interesting. Gives good, challenging design assignments. Is known to wear an awesome flat cap almost year round...have been temped to buy him a spare one!
Very friendly and willing to help. HE makes jokes in the higher-level courses and is very easy-going. If you have the option to take Mayeed then please do so, you will be glad that you did.

Easy going guy. Lets you use notes and textbook on tests, but keep it on the hush hush, he doesn't want other professors knowing that and judging him (said so to our class). Teaches average and helpfulness average. I would recommend him.

Dr. Mayeed works to the absolute extent to ensure that you understand the material. All problems are similar to problems in the textbook. He does give partial credit and the tests are very easy to pass SO LONG AS YOU DO PRACTICE PROBLEMS from the book. Most tests are modified book problems. No surprises or trick questions. The book is mandatory.

very clear. makes funny jokes if you catch them, haha. his test are only 1 problem and 2 for the midterm and final. if you show some effort and are in the right direction, he give a 6 or 7 of 10 score for the probs. But if you do the probs in the text book, you will do very well. No doubt!

Dynamics is a hard class but he makes the class manageable. A little rigid at the beginning of the semester but loosened up as the semester went on. Mini tests, hw, and midterm are all fair and easier than examples done in class.

Strength of Materials Lab instructor. Grading is easy but only if you complete the lab report...which is a group report. There is one midterm exam and a final exam which are open book, open notes. He is very quiet and doesn't respond to e-mail messages.
Great Professor,his tests are reasonable and he gives partial credit, so attempt every question.

Good Professor, had him for the first time he taught at SPSU and he did a good job. Learned much about mechanics of materials. Accent makes him a little hard to understand but if you follow him along with the textbook and study for exams you can get an "A".
